item.title: Researchers Uncover ECScape Flaw in Amazon ECS Enabling Cross-Task Credential Theft
item.description:
Cybersecurity researchers have demonstrated an "end-to-end privilege escalation chain" in Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS) that could be exploited by an attacker to conduct lateral movement, access sensitive data, and seize control of the cloud environment.
The attack technique has been codenamed ECScape by Sweet Security researcher Naor Haziz, who presented the findings today at the

item.title: Leading AI Claude Predicts the Price of XRP, Pi Coin and Solana by the End of 2025
item.description:
Claude predicts altcoins could outshine Bitcoin in the next cycle, projecting an 87% rise for XRP, a potential 1,500% leap for Pi Network and a run to $1,000 for Solana by late 2025. The outlook has linked these targets to renewed SEC engagement through Project Crypto and Bitcoin’s push above $120k.

item.title: SEC Commissioner Caroline Crenshaw Pushes Back On Liquid Staking Statement
item.description:
Caroline Crenshaw has pushed back against the SEC Division of Corporation Finance’s view that some liquid staking sits outside securities laws, arguing the staff’s position rests on factual leaps. While she has questioned the comfort it offers, Chair Paul Atkins has welcomed the guidance.

item.description:
